title: La Phil#039;s Virtual Reality App Puts You in the Orchestra
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
9 Sep 2015 01:14 AM EST 
Imagine you are at a performance of the Los Angeles Philharmonic orchestra — but not in the audience. Instead, you’re in the middle of the action, right between conductor Gustavo Dudamel and his orchestra as they launch into Beethoven’s 5th. Take a look to the left, and you see Dudamel up close. That’s the experience the LA Phil want to bring to the world with a new virtual reality app that’s being released for he Oculus Rift and Samsung’s Gear VR headsets this week.La Phil’s director of digital initiatives Amy Seidenwurm says the orchestra wants to use new technology to reach people who aren’t likely to watch it perform live.
